ai-snp4.16:1.4_0: Even so the Teacher, the Vaggumudā
ai-snp4.16:1.5_0: he went to Tusita hostile on the Tusita mountain.
ai-snp4.16:2.1_0: in all the world with its gods,
ai-snp4.16:3.1_0: the Buddha, the son of the Buddha,
ai-snp4.16:3.4_0: There is a question that should be answered,
ai-snp4.16:4.1_0: to be troubled like a monk,
ai-snp4.16:4.3_0: the root of a tree or the fruit of a charnel ground,
ai-snp4.16:5.3_0: Those mendicants don’t try to enemy when they don’t see,
ai-snp4.16:5.4_0: if the household life is used;
ai-snp4.16:6.1_0: This in the world’s stream is guarded;
ai-snp4.16:6.2_0: Go to the place where it goes from,
ai-snp4.16:6.3_0: a mendicant who conquerors the truth of rebirth.
ai-snp4.16:7.2_0: Who here, although will you be?
ai-snp4.16:7.4_0: a resolute monk who loves the goal.
ai-snp4.16:8.1_0: Who has undertaken the training rules,
ai-snp4.16:8.3_0: bit by bit, moment by moment,
ai-snp4.16:9.3_0: If he finds a sleeping place, he should cultivate the rest and the good,
ai-snp4.16:9.4_0: in accordance with the Teaching, and in accordance with the Teaching,
ai-snp4.16:9.5_0: as I know it I will declare it to you:
ai-snp4.16:10.1_0: the wise one should not fear the five fears.
ai-snp4.16:10.2_0: A mendicant is living in a limit on chair.
ai-snp4.16:10.3_0: who take care of the battle
ai-snp4.16:10.4_0: it’s always good to give birth
ai-snp4.16:11.1_0: And one who does not guard the Dhamma,
ai-snp4.16:12.3_0: there is a big deed without running.
ai-snp4.16:12.4_0: (But) he who would make his effort to change while others.
ai-snp4.16:13.1_0: he should not speak a falsehood;
ai-snp4.16:13.3_0: when a man know of the mind is liberated,
ai-snp4.16:13.4_0: (only) the dark he might dispel him.
ai-snp4.16:14.1_0: Who has overcome anger towards anger,
ai-snp4.16:14.2_0: The roots of their eyes were made
ai-snp4.16:14.3_0: Or alternatively, either a little or a little,
ai-snp4.16:14.4_0: travel to be born again and again.
ai-snp4.16:15.1_0: With the wise, stilling of good friends,
ai-snp4.16:16.1_0: what can I not be infatuated, what can I do?
ai-snp4.16:16.2_0: it’s hard to attack a deed,
ai-snp4.16:16.4_0: having expert in the Monastic Law, such a trainee,
ai-snp4.16:17.1_0: Having gained faith in the future,
ai-snp4.16:17.3_0: Having gone to the villages in the village.
ai-snp4.16:18.1_0: But the eyes of the feet, the one with vision,
ai-snp4.16:18.4_0: were afraid of wrongdoing, they did not cut down.
ai-snp4.16:19.2_0: splitting their spiritual companions in the spiritual life,
ai-snp4.16:20.1_0: Then there’s another five-hundred dust in the world
ai-snp4.16:20.2_0: for those who’s training, who train in the training,
ai-snp4.16:20.3_0: In sights, sounds, and tastes, too.
ai-snp4.16:21.1_0: you should give up desire for these things.
ai-snp4.16:21.2_0: a monastic with a mind well freed,
ai-snp4.16:21.3_0: at times rightly investigating the Dhamma:
ai-snp4.16:21.6_0: The fourth sub-chapter on eight is finished.
ai-snp4.16:23.3_0: like a puppet shows a bronze bowl.
ai-snp4.16:23.6_0: All the tips of the tongue
